column5: Hey guys, I have a lot of loose roe that I froze just under a month ago. When I took it out today the eggs are a clear yellow and it takes a lot of pressure to break one. Also they barely even smell at all. I have never had this happen to me and I have been steelheading many years now. Has anyone else ever had this problem? What can I do to soften it up a little? any info you guys can give me will help me out. thanks   -Fishnpro
You could soften them up with a soak in luke warm water...
sounds like they were over cured in cold water. I would use them the way they are. If you want try soaking them in warm water with some salt to soften them up.
Get a box of crackers..  Place about a dozen on each cracker ...  Have yourself a fancy party..
if ya need help with your roe....get a couple of oars to help out
Lol thanks for the help guys. I ended up letting them sit in warm water for a bit and they softened up a little. Gonna try them out tomorrow and see if they work.
